RBI MPC August 2025: From rate pause to consumer centric moves  Key Highlights
summary: The Reserve Bank of India, in its August 2025 policy review, kept the repo rate unchanged at 5.5% and retained a neutral stance, citing the need for continued policy transmission and macroeconomic caution due to tariff uncertainty.
fullContent: The Reserve Bank of India, in its August 2025 policy review, kept the repo rate unchanged at 5.5% and retained a neutral stance, citing the need for continued policy transmission and macroeconomic caution due to tariff uncertainty. Governor Sanjay Malhotra flagged a potential uptick in inflation towards the end of FY26, even as CPI projections for the year were revised sharply lower. Here are the key announcements from todays policy statement:

Oil Prices Inch Higher as Trumps Trade Threats Counter Oversupply Fears
summary: Oil prices were moving higher again early on Wednesday morning, recovering from oversupply fears that had driven them to five-month lows. The most recent rebound was driven by Trumps escalating trade offensive against India over its continued imports of Russian crude.
fullContent: Oil prices were moving higher again early on Wednesday morning, recovering from oversupply fears that had driven them to five-month lows. The most recent rebound was driven by Trumps escalating trade offensive against India over its continued imports of Russian crude. At the time of writing, Brent crude futures had risen to $68.10 per barrel and WTI had climbed to $65.59.
